name: Dick Hyman
description:
'''Richard Hyman''' (born March 8, 1927) is an American [[jazz]] pianist and composer. Over a 70-year career, he has worked as a pianist, organist, arranger, [[music director]], electronic musician, and composer. He was named a [[National Endowment for the Arts]] Jazz Masters fellow in 2017.

As a pianist, Hyman has been praised for his versatility. ''[[Downbeat Magazine|DownBeat]]'' magazine characterized him as "a pianist of longstanding grace and bountiful talent, with an ability to adapt to nearly any historical style, from stride to bop to modernist sound-painting."

His daughter Judy Hyman is a founding member of [[The Horse Flies]], an American alternative rock/folk band based in Ithaca, NY.
His grandson is designer and artist [[Adam Charlap Hyman]].
